intro: Corethrogyne sessilis, commonly known as the sessile corethrogyne, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family, characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are oppositely arranged and have a slightly velvety texture, while its stems are erect and somewhat woody. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
